module.name: ap239_part_definition_information
module.keywords: module, part definition, part identification, interface, interface specification, requirement management

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the:

ul.li: representation of the data that identify parts and their versions;
representation of characterization views of a version of a part;
representation of parts, their versions, their definitions, and their management information, such as dates, that are assigned to them;
representation of alias identifications assigned to product data;
representation of the data that identify a product and the categories of products it belongs to;
representation of the data that designate a version of a product;
representation of characterization views of a product version;
representation of relationships between versions of products;
representation of assignments of an identifier to product data;
representation and classification of documents and document information that may apply to product document information;
representation of properties of objects, their values and types, and classifications;

representation of information that records the identification of an existing or potential future artifact - an actual product whose properties can only be known by observation or by derivation from observations;
representation of the life cycle phase of existing interfaces between actual products (as realized), and includes planned interfaces between planned products.
representation of relationships between requirements and items to which they are assigned, and between requirements and the items which are their source;
representation of the information that identify a requirement and versions of requirements;
representation of characterization views of a requirement version;

representation of relationships between requirements which are expressed as relationships between requirement view definitions, for example, the relationships are dependent on the version of the requirement and the view of that version;
representation of a type of state;

purpose.p: Ap239_part_definition_information describes the product's performance, functional, and physical attributes. It includes requirements information and provides the technical basis for actions taken during all product life cycle phases and for product validation.
The type of information and documents that ap239_part_definition_information may represent may be known by different names (aliases). Some of these are:
This module combines the functionality of the following modules to provide the capability to classify and represent part information, documents, document data, and management data.
The module specifies the representation of the information that identify parts and their versions.
The module specifies the representation of characterization views of a version of a part.
The module specifies the representation of the information that identify a product and the categories of products it belongs to.
The module specifies the representation of the data that designate a version of a product.
The module specifies the representation of characterization views of a product version.
The module specifies the representation of relationships between versions of products.
The module specifies the representation of assignments of an identifier to product data.
The module specifies the representation of alias identifications assigned to product data.

The module specifies an application module for the representation and classification of documents and document information that may apply to product and document information. This module combines the functionality of the following modules to provide the capability to classify and represent documents, document and management information.
The module enables the representation of:

ul.li: information that identify documents () and versions of documents ();

li.p: facility to assign documents () to product data, or to assign sections of documents to product data ();

ul.li: definitions of document versions in a digital () or physical format ();
digital files () stored on an electronic storage device or non-digital hardcopies ();
relationships between files () or document definitions ();
assignment of properties to a particular representation of a document version or a file ();

purpose.p: The Document module addresses the requirements to define a document. A document is defined as a body of information that can be packaged for delivery on a single medium. Some examples of documents are:
A document may be represented by a set of digital files that collectively represents a complete digital document.
Electronic document representations are sets of digital files that collectively represent the entire document.
purpose.example: A set of raster files, a set of IGES files, or a combination set of raster and IGES files that represent a complete document.
purpose.p: Non-electronic document representations are sets of pages, sheets, cards, or other medium, together with the message recorded on the medium that collectively represents the entire document. A document may have more than one document representation; some of these may be electronic while others are not. All document representations of a single iteration of a particular document must have the same information content; formats (both electronic and visual) may vary, but the content must be the same. Different formats are different representations of the document.
purpose.example: Paper plots of technical drawings, Mylar traces, microfiche, or floppy disks are examples of non-digital files.
purpose.p: Document management provides a capability to attach, link or reference documents, with a limited set of metadata to allow searching on author, date, version title, type, encoding method, etc. It also provides a capability to classify documents.

Document management also provides a capability to hold definitions of "documents" which can be generated directly from data held in any format. This provides ability to assemble documents from file, including pictures, images, videos and the results of queries on data held in any format. Document management enables holding information contained within intelligent documents.

The module enables the representation and classification of management information that may apply to document and product data. This module combines the functionality of the following modules to extend the capability to classify documents and document information, and to provide the capability to classify and represent management information.
The module provides the ability for other modules to assign management information to product data. Such management data comprises:

In some cases this information are also applied to the management information. For example, to specify who specified the security classification for some product data and when, requires the assignment of person and organization, and date and time to the security classification assignment.
The module provides for a classification of an attribute on an EXPRESS entity. The standard values used by the classification are defined as Classes .
purpose.note: The definition of the may be stored in an external class library.
When the attribute of an EXPRESS entity is classified, the value of the attribute on an instance of the EXPRESS entity will be the name or identifier of the class.
purpose.p: The module provides for the assignment of classification information to document, product data. This provides a generic capability that may be specialized and further constrained in other application modules.
The module specifies the representation of Classes that are defined external to a data exchange file in an External Class Library.
The module provides for the representation of assignments of an identifier to product data.
The module enables set theory relationships between document classes. This includes the following relationships:
The module specifies an application module for the representation of properties of objects, their values and types, and classifications, in order to enable product life cycle support.

The module specifies an application module for the representation of data that records the identification of an existing or potential future artifact - an actual product whose properties can only be known by observation or by derivation from observations.

It is likely, but not essential, that the artifact, was or will be made from a version of a product design, which will be represented by the product_identification, product_version and product_view_definition modules.
An actual product that has been made is represented by a entity.
A product that is planned to be made is represented a entity.
purpose.example: The front wheel on your car is an actual product - .
The computer with the serial number "PN X0467-71281" is an actual product - .
The plane, with tail number "GXY 8910", ordered by "Air 3000" that is just about to be manufactured is a predicted product - .
purpose.p: The module specifies an application module that supports the requirement to manage interfaces between products (see FIGURE 1). An interface is the interaction between co-functioning products, or a product and its environment, and, in order to ensure repeatability, is the subject of an . The specification defines the product attributes that are necessary to exist at a common boundary.
In some industry sectors, an is referred to as an Interface Control Document or Drawing.
An is a and, thus, may have an identification, versions, and view definitions.
The interaction of two interfaced products is represented by an . Many types of interaction are possible.
The interaction, as defined by the , is through at least one .
An is a and, thus, may have the attributes that are necessary to ensure the viability of the interface.

The module specifies an application module for the representation of the life cycle phase of existing interfaces between actual products (as realized), and includes planned interfaces between planned products. See module ISO-10303-1251 - Interface for additional information.
The module specifies the representation of relationships between requirements and items to which they are assigned, and between requirements and the items which are their source.
The module specifies the representation of the data that identify a requirement and versions of requirements.
purpose.note: The concept of a "requirement", in this context, relates chiefly to the exchange and sharing of data between requirements engineering applications such as those used in the systems engineering and related industrial domains.
purpose.p: The module specifies the representation of characterization views of a requirement version.

The module specifies the representation of relationships between requirements which are expressed as relationships between requirement view definitions, for example, the relationships are dependent on the version of the requirement and the view of that version.
The module specifies the representation of a type of state.
The module also identifies a type of state by specifying the criteria that shall be satisfied for something to be in a state of that type.
purpose.example: A state definition that is defined by the presence of an identified type of fault in a type of product.
purpose.p: The module specifies the representation of state observed.

The module identifies an observed state, which may be either predicted or actual, and enables it to be linked to the thing or things that are in the state. An observed state represents a period of time when the criteria defining the state type either are or will be satisfied for one or more items. Actual observed states therefore correspond to a period in the life of something. States are not limited to products but may apply to activities, people, and organizations.

inscope.li: identification of a part;
identification of a non-countable material;
identification of a version of a part or of a non-countable material;
identification of properties that characterize a version of a part, relevant in one or more application domains and one or more life-cycle stages;
assignment of an alias identifier to product;
representation of the data that identify a product;
inclusion of a product in a product category;
identification of a version of a product;
identification of properties that characterize a version of a product, suitable for one or more application domains and one or more life-cycle stages;
identification of a universe of discourse suitable for the description of products;
identification of a relationship between two versions of product;
identification of an identity relationship between two versions of product made by two organizations;
identification of an approval;
assignment of an approval to product;
relationship between two approvals;
identification of an approval status;
definition of a certificate;
assignment of a certificate to product data;
creating and identifying the contract;
associating product data to the contract;
date, person and organization information;
identification of a language;
identification of the language in which a text attribute is expressed;
association of a translation in a particular language to a text attribute;
definition of a security classification level;
assignment of a security classification level to product data;
specific part classification;
assignment of an identification to product data;
assignment of documents to product data;
assignment of parts of or sections of documents to product data;
assignment of properties to a file;
assignment of properties to a particular representation of a document version;
definition of a document version in a digital format such as an electronic file;
definition of a document version in a non-digital format such as paper copy;
identification of a digital file, such as a file on a computer system;
identification of a document;
identification of a physical file, such as a stack of paper;
identification of a version of a document;
identification of Document_definitions in a digital or physical storage system;
identification of Files in a digital or physical storage system;
relationships between document definitions;
relationships between files;
specification of document-specific properties;
specification of locations of Document_definitions in a digital or physical storage system;
specification of locations of Files in a digital or physical storage system;
specification of the representation of document-specific properties;
assignment of management information to product data;
assignment of management information;
assignment of management information to management information;
association of a value, represented by a class, to an attribute on an entity representing management information;
assignment of classification information to management information;
identification of a class that is external to a data exchange file;
identification of an external class library that is not in an exchange file and holds the definition for classes used in the exchange file;
reference to a class in an external class library;
assignment of an identification to management information;
specification of a property definition;
specification of property values;
single numerical property values with units;
ranges of numerical values;
text as property value;
specification of a property that is a list of properties;
qualification of the property as to type, uncertainty, or meaning;
specification of the definitions needed to assign management resource information to a class of properties;
specification of the definitions needed to classify properties;
classification of property definitions and values;
representation of the information to identify an actual product;
representation of the information to identify an actual product prior to its realization - a planned product;
identification of the interface specification;
identification of a version of an interface specification;
representation of an interaction or connection between two or more products;
identification of the interface connector, the part of a product with which one or more other products or the environment will interact;
identification of the life cycle phase (designed, planned or realized) of an interface connector, the product or part with which one or more other products will interact;
assignment of a requirement to a product or other item
identification a source of a requirement
representation of the information that identify a requirement and its versions
identification of properties that characterize a version of a requirement, suitable for one or more application domains and one or more life-cycle phases;
identification of a universe of discourse suitable for the description of requirements;
relationships between requirements that are expressed at the view definition level
definition of state
definition of what is needed for a state definition to exist
relationship between two or more state definitions
relationship between a state definition or type of state and the product, people or organization that it affects
individual or realized states;
relationship between two or more states;
relationship between an individual or realized state and the product, people or organization that it affects.

outscope.li: identification of breakdowns of a part or product;
identification of parent-child relationships;
relationships between elements in different breakdown;
relationships between two parts or products
representation of an assembly or product structure;
decomposition of requirements;
process of translation that results in a translation of a particular text;
characterization of a product in a particular domain;
representation of any use of a product;
activity data;
assignment of Parts to product or activity data;
specification of locations of Parts or Products;
existence of a class;
characterization of a classification;
contents of an external class library;
classification and the specification of complete set membership;
mappings between sets or classes;
class or set relationships that are not set theory relationships;
definitions of classes;
assignments of particular properties to particular classes;

description and structure of the requirement definition
The nature of the assignment relationship may be further elucidated by use of the description attribute of the requirement_assignment entity data type.
characterization of a requirement in a particular domain;
representation of any use of a requirement;
behavior or history of product data capable of having individual state;
behavior or history of product data capable of having state.

description.p: This UoF specifies the definitional information for the classification and representation of part information, documents, document data, and management data.
No additional entities are defined in this UoF.

alt_map.description: The mapping for when the identification is not an alias identification.
alt_map.refpath: applied_identification_assignment applied_identification_assignment <= identification_assignment identification_assignment.role -> identification_role applied_identification_assignment.items[i] -> identification_item *> ap239_padi_identification_item ap239_padi_identification_item = approval_status

alt_map.description: The mapping for when the identification is an alias identification.
alt_map.refpath: [applied_identification_assignment {applied_identification_assignment <= identification_assignment identification_assignment.role -> identification_role {(identification_role.name='alias')}} applied_identification_assignment.items[i] -> identification_item *> ap239_padi_identification_item ap239_padi_identification_item = approval_status] [aliasable_item *> ap239_padi_aliasable_item ap239_padi_aliasable_item = approval_status]

alt_map.description: The mapping for when the identification is not an alias identification.
alt_map.refpath: applied_identification_assignment {applied_identification_assignment <= identification_assignment identification_assignment.role -> identification_role applied_identification_assignment.items[i] -> identification_item *> ap239_padi_identification_item ap239_padi_identification_item = product product <- product_related_product_category.products[i] product_related_product_category <= product_category product_category.name='interface connector'}
